intro.title: What is this?
intro.text: D-GRE Stock Exchange is a realistic stock market game where you can try real trading strategies with virtual money. Buy and sell stocks from 14 well-known companies, watch price movements in real-time, and try to grow your portfolio. Virtual players also trade and influence prices – just like on the real stock market.

step1.title: Watch the Market
step1.text: On the right, you'll see all available stocks with their current prices and trends. Click on a stock to see its detailed chart.

step2.title: Buy Stocks
step2.text: Click the Buy button on any stock. Choose the quantity and order type (Market for instant purchase, Limit for a specific price).

step3.title: Manage Your Portfolio
step3.text: On the left, you'll see your portfolio with all purchased stocks, available cash, and open orders. Keep an eye on the total value!

step4.title: Sell for Profit
step4.text: When the price has risen, sell your stocks for a profit. Or use Stop-Loss orders to limit your losses.

rules.title: Game Rules
rules.rule1: You start with customizable starting capital (default: $100,000).
rules.rule2: Prices update every few seconds – you can adjust the speed in settings.
rules.rule3: You can only execute one order per stock per trading cycle.
rules.rule4: There are trading fees and spreads like on the real stock market.
rules.rule5: Virtual players with different strategies also influence prices.
rules.rule6: Goal: Grow your starting capital through smart investment decisions!

orderTypes.title: Order Types Explained
orderTypes.market: Immediate buy/sell at current market price.
orderTypes.limit: Only executes when the price reaches your desired level.
orderTypes.stop: Automatic trigger at a specific price – ideal for breakouts or stop-loss.

marketMechanics.title: Spread & Slippage
marketMechanics.spread: The spread is the difference between the buy price (ask) and sell price (bid) of a stock. When you buy, you pay slightly more than the displayed price; when you sell, you receive slightly less. This difference represents a hidden trading cost and is how market makers earn their profit.
marketMechanics.slippage: Slippage occurs when your order is executed at a different price than expected. This happens especially with market orders and during high volatility. In real markets, large orders can also move the price. The displayed effective price includes potential slippage so you know your actual cost.

tips.title: Tips for Beginners
tips.tip1: Diversify! Don't put all your money in one company.
tips.tip2: Watch the trends in the chart before you buy.
tips.tip3: Use Stop-Loss orders to avoid large losses.

virtualPlayers.title: Virtual Players
virtualPlayers.text: In the footer bar, you'll find the 'Show virtual players' button. This opens a panel showing all AI-controlled players. You can see their portfolios, cash balances, and trading decisions. Observe their strategies – from conservative to risk-seeking – and learn how different approaches work in the market.
